title: Kuntisuyu
text:
Kuntisuyu or Kunti Suyu (<a href="Quechua%20language">Quechua</a> "kunti" <a href="west">west</a>, "suyu" region, part of a territory, each of the four regions which formed the <a href="Inca%20Empire">Inca Empire</a>, "western region") was the <a href="Ordinal%20directions">southwestern</a> provincial region of the <a href="Inca%20Empire">Inca Empire</a>. Kuntisuyu was the smallest "suyu" of all and was located along the southern coast of modern Peru, extending into the highlands towards <a href="Cusco">Cusco</a>. Along with <a href="Qullasuyu">Qullasuyu</a>, it was part of the "<a href="Inca_Government%23Organization_of_the_empire">Urin Suyukuna</a>" or "Lower Quarters" of the empire.
Wamani.
Each "suyu" was divided into "wamani", or provinces. Kuntisuyu included the "wamani" of:
